description: Conversion of mixed use residential units comprising bedsits and studio flats at first and second floor into two self-contained one-bedroom flats.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers 12/018/ 1 and 2 and received 27th September 2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority. Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes standards prior to the first occupation of the development, unless otherwise agreed to in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure the development provides access for all future occupiers and meets Lifetime Homes Standards in accordance with section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policy 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), polcy 1.1 (h) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026 and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7: 'Accessible Ealing'. | Details of insulation shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority for the floor/ceiling separating the commercial part of the premises from the residential accommodation hereby approved, before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that they are resistant to the passage of smoke, fumes and odours and that the insulation is sufficient to prevent noise disturbance.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any of the units and shall thereafter be permanently retained.  REASON: To prevent noise disturbance in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of the residential element of the proposed development in accordance with section  4 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies  4.1 and 4.11of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment', policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026  and Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, a noise survey and details for mitigation works, inclluding the insulation of the building envelope with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided to protect habitable rooms from noise and vibration shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The mitigation shall take into account the ventilation strategy for the building approved in accordance with Condition 6 of this permission.  The approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the building from noise as the development will be affected by high levels of traffic noise, in accordance with section 4 of  the National Plannign Policy Framework, policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026  and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of a ventilation strategy setting out measures to provide fresh air ventilation from the rear of the building  at high level to the habitable rooms of the residential units facing The Broadway shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved measures shall be fully installed prior to first occupation of the development and shall be retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure suitable measures are installed to protect residents from air pollution, in accordance with section 4 of  the National Plannign Policy Framework, policy 2.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026  and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 3: 'Air Quality'. | Refuse storage shall be provided within the area labelled as 'Services' and shown in the approved plan no. 12/018/ 2, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   REASON: To ensure an appropriate managment of refuse , in accordance with the National Plannign Policy Framework, policy 2.10 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 1.1 (e) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026  and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 4: ' Refuse and recycling storage'. | Notwithstanding the details on the approved drawings, no development shall take place until a scheme demonstrating secure and safe access to the development hereby permitted has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved scheme, which will be permanently retained thereafter. The self- contained flats hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the scheme is fully operational in accordance with the details approved.  REASON: In pursuance to the safety of prospective occupiers of the development , in accordance with the National Plannign Policy Framework, , policy 7.3 of the London Plan 2011, policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 1.1 (e) of the Ealing's Development Strategy 2026  and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 7: ' Safer Ealing'.
